data.title: THE PLACE TO EAT IN TAR HEEL LAND
data.text: u have to know where the entrance is but once up the elevator to overlook the downtown and UNC. service great and helpful    menu is fun and surprising. Fried chicken worth the trip alone. if you enjoy hot n spicy get thr jalapeno and fried pickles. full bar. parking lots nearby.

data.title: Always a good experience!
data.text: Wide range of food to suit most anyone from steak to jambalaya. Great selection of beers brewed by them. Old Well White is my favorite! Busy UNC game days so get there early

data.title: Depends on the night!
data.text: I've had lunch, dinner, brewskies, etc., and it all depends on the day! That, of course, is not the best of recommendations. Still, TOTH is THE go-to place for TarHeel action. Geat ambience, fun bar scene, GREAT balcony overlooking Franklin Street. Have I mentioned food yet. Whoops!

data.title: Terrible service and food
data.text: Terrible service,poor menu, snobby wait staff, stay away went there on Veterans Day to celebrate family service, terrible decision, extremely disappointing

data.title: Top of My List
data.text: Great University town restaurant with a fabulous view and solid menu.  My daughter is still talking about the Pork Rib Mac and Cheese she ordered and devoured!  I especially liked the organic vodka cocktail with grapefruit juice!  The service was very good, even considering they had several rather large parties going on.  I appreciated the fact that they have many gluten free choices as well.  A lovely setting and terrific view!  They had a lovely outdoor dining area, but it was a hot night so we opted to stay inside for the air conditioning.

data.title: Nice place
data.text: Nice view of franklin st. Service was very slow and food nothing out of the box. Good experience in general.

data.title: Staff is extremely rude
data.text: Stopped by after dinner for drinks around 8:30PM. No line and at least 6 empty tables. After we were seated we were told that we couldn't sit unless we ordered entrees.

data.title: Good beer! Good food! Good service!
data.text: We visit brewpubs whenever we travel because....we like beer! Generally, these places have simple, but interesting and pleasant food on the menu and Top of the Hill was no exception. We had the braised beef short rib and hot bacon spinach salad. Both were very good, although the beef was a bit crispy on the outside and drier on the inside than one would expect from a beef rib. It was still very tasty and the sauce was excellent!

data.title: Great view with very good food
data.text:
On a recent trip to Chapel Hill, we dined at Top of the Hill. It was a pleasant evening and were given a table on a outdoor patio overlooking bustling Franklin Street. It was a delightful way to spend the evening.

We ordered the Lizard Chips (fried dill pickles and jalapenos) as an appetizer for the four of us. They were very light and crispy and plenty for four people.

My wife ordered the Shrimp Scampi Risotto, even though it sounded weird that it included marinara sauce. She was SO glad she did! The marinara was lightly poured around the outside edges of the risotto, so that you could include as much or as little as you wanted with the shrimp and risotto. She loved it.

Having grown up in southern Louisiana, I cautiously ordered the French Quarter Jambalaya. While it may not beat jambalaya that I have actually eaten in the French Quarter, I must say that it ran a very good second, and I would order it again.

Our server was attentive and very friendly - overall a very nice evening!!!

data.title: Delicious Dinner in College Visit
data.text: Great meal on a recent visit to UNC. I had the Wild Mushroom Grit Cakes with shrimp and it was delicious. Our server recommend it. My daughter had the fried chicken. Very big portions that you could share and great service.

data.title: Really cool place to go!
data.text: A group of us were in town for a conference and were looking for a place for dinner. Top of the Hill was on the list the hotel provided, it was 4th on the Trip Advisor list, so we thought we'd try it. We were not disappointed! The service was great. We arrived with no reservation and they were very accommodating. We sat outside on the patio and had a great view of town. Our server did a great job of providing suggestions and descriptions. I had the Cranapple beer and loved it! We had both the sweet potato fried with pepper jelly and cream cheese (do it!) and the pretzels with beer cheese dip (do this, too!) and were really happy with both. I had the goat cheese salad (very good!) the guys had the burger and jambalaya and were happy with their choices, too. It was a great place to go for drinks, dinner, appetizers and to hang out for a bit. I would go back again and would definitely recommend it to friends.

data.title: Good view -- fair food -- fair service
data.text:
I ate at Top of the Hill for the first time on a trip to Chapel Hill. The view from the outside patio area was great and it was a great experience being able to get the vibe from the street while eating dinner. Unfortunately everyone from the hostess to the servers were pretty unenthusiastic and, while I wouldn't say slow, sure took their time. The food was good, and while I'm not much of a food critic, I thought on the whole it was smothered far too much in whatever sauce they had.

In sum, if you check out this spot you probably won't leave unsatisfied, but my guess is there are better places around Chapel Hill.

data.title: Great atmosphere
data.text: This was a great place for our family to enjoy some time together.  The location is within walking distance to the campus, the brewery is fascinating and the deserts are INCREDIBLE!  We will return!

data.title: You can't pay me enough...
data.text: Good place for a drink. Especially if you're under 30. They make their own pretty good beer. They have a killer view from the outside patio. But God save the soul of the poor sinner who made their menu. It's all out of a bag or a box. Grrrr.

data.title: Always a great stop
data.text: Top of the Hill is an iconic dining spot in Chapel Hill with a premiere spot on Franklin Street.  Great beer list, great vibe.  I love the wild mushroom grit cakes and my companions enjoyed the fried chicken.

data.title: Great beer flight
data.text:
The top of the hill bar and restaurant is as the name suggests, on the top of the highest hill of Chapel Hill. The same one the Chapel is on. 

Anyways, they have great craft beers, of which you can get a sampler through their nice beer flight with 6 glasses of 5 ounce each with different beers.

data.title: Great Food, Beer, and View
data.text: My son, his friend, and I went to this restaurant for dinner. You take an elevator from street level to the third floor. If you choose to sit outside as we did, you have a great view of the activities on the street below which is just off the UNC campus. I ordered the Thai Salmon. It was well prepared and very tasty. My son and his friend ordered one of the large salads and were pleased with the choice. I also ordered one of their craft beers - a medium ale. It was very good.

data.title: Great food
data.text: I have eaten here at least 10 times. Love the whiskey braised beef and fried pickles. They have a fun menu. Great for groups. They are a brewery also.

data.title: Noisy, Tasty, Salty ... Mixed Overall
data.text:
This place is quite nice, in that it has an iconic view of Chapel Hill and University of North Carolina. It clearly is popular, and the meal prices are reasonable. That said, however, it is quite noisy, so detailed conversations is not going to be much of an option. The menu is quite varied, and has some things that look interesting. I tried the green tomato caprese salad, the fried dill pickles, the sweet potato chips, and (entree) the grit cakes in mushroom sauce. 

Everything was tasty, I have to admit. Everything was also fried (even the green tomato salad!), which may be a regional thing, but everything was also a bit on the salty side. I don't MIND salty, but I need a break from it at various times in the course of a meal.

In sum, nice place, and interesting, not-in-the-box food. Not perfect, but not a waste of time either.

data.title: Great place to watch a game, minutes from campus!
data.text: Good appetizers and craft beers.  Went there to meet our Unc student.  Excellent location, great university decor. Chicken tenders and lizard chips were favorites at our table!
